legal_citations: Trade Union and Labour Relations (Consolidation) Act 1992

sections.text:
Further to our consultation meetings on [CONSULTATION_DATES], I regret to inform you that your position of [JOB_TITLE] has been made redundant.

This letter confirms that your employment will terminate on [TERMINATION_DATE] by reason of redundancy.
sections.compliance_notes: Must follow full consultation process before issuing redundancy notice

sections.text:
Reason for Redundancy:

[BUSINESS_REASON - e.g., The Company is restructuring its [DEPARTMENT] department to reduce costs and improve efficiency. Your role has been identified as at risk because [SPECIFIC_REASON].]

The decision to make redundancies was necessary due to: [BUSINESS_JUSTIFICATION]
sections.compliance_notes: Must be a genuine redundancy situation under ERA 1996 s139: (a) business closure, (b) workplace closure, or (c) diminished requirement for work of a particular kind

sections.text:
Selection Process:

The selection for redundancy was made using fair and objective criteria applied consistently across the pool of employees in similar roles. The criteria used were:

[CRITERION_1: e.g., Skills and qualifications] - [SCORE]
[CRITERION_2: e.g., Performance and disciplinary record] - [SCORE]
[CRITERION_3: e.g., Attendance record] - [SCORE]
[CRITERION_4: e.g., Experience and flexibility] - [SCORE]

Total Score: [TOTAL_SCORE]
sections.compliance_notes: Selection criteria must be objective, fair, and non-discriminatory. Avoid 'last in, first out' (LIFO) as it may indirectly discriminate by age

sections.text:
Alternative Employment:

We have considered whether any suitable alternative employment is available within the Company. [OPTION 1: Unfortunately, there are no suitable alternative roles available at this time.] [OPTION 2: Details of available alternative roles are enclosed at Annex A. Please confirm by [RESPONSE_DATE] if you wish to be considered for any of these positions.]
sections.compliance_notes: Duty to consider and offer suitable alternative employment; unreasonable refusal of suitable alternative may affect redundancy payment

sections.text:
Notice Period:

Your contractual notice period is [CONTRACTUAL_NOTICE]. However, you are entitled to statutory minimum notice of [STATUTORY_NOTICE] based on your [YEARS_SERVICE] years of service.

You will receive [NOTICE_GIVEN] notice (being the greater of contractual and statutory), and your employment will terminate on [TERMINATION_DATE].

[OPTION 1: You will be required to work your notice period.]
[OPTION 2: You will be placed on garden leave during your notice period and should not attend the workplace unless requested.]
[OPTION 3: The Company will make a payment in lieu of notice (PILON) and your employment will terminate immediately.]
sections.compliance_notes: Statutory notice: 1 week (1 month-2 years), +1 week per year (2-12 years), max 12 weeks (12+ years). Must give whichever is greater: contractual or statutory

sections.text:
Redundancy Payment:

You are entitled to a statutory redundancy payment calculated as follows:

- Years of service: [YEARS_SERVICE] years
- Calculation:
  * [YEARS_UNDER_22] years aged under 22: [YEARS_UNDER_22] × 0.5 weeks' pay = [CALCULATION_1] weeks
  * [YEARS_22_TO_40] years aged 22-40: [YEARS_22_TO_40] × 1 week's pay = [CALCULATION_2] weeks
  * [YEARS_41_PLUS] years aged 41+: [YEARS_41_PLUS] × 1.5 weeks' pay = [CALCULATION_3] weeks
  * Total: [TOTAL_WEEKS] weeks' pay

- Weekly pay (capped): £[WEEKLY_PAY] (statutory cap £700 from April 2025)
- Statutory redundancy payment: £[STATUTORY_AMOUNT]

[OPTIONAL: In addition, the Company will make an ex gratia payment of £[EX_GRATIA_AMOUNT]]

Total payment: £[TOTAL_PAYMENT]

This will be paid on [PAYMENT_DATE] subject to deduction of tax and National Insurance as applicable.
sections.compliance_notes: Statutory redundancy pay: 0.5 week per year (under 22), 1 week (22-40), 1.5 weeks (41+). Max 20 years, weekly pay capped at £700 (April 2025). First £30,000 tax-free. Qualifying service: 2+ years

sections.text:
Other Payments:

You will also receive payment for:

- Accrued but untaken holiday: [HOLIDAY_DAYS] days = £[HOLIDAY_PAY]
- [OPTIONAL: Outstanding commission/bonus: £[BONUS_AMOUNT]]
- [OPTIONAL: Notice pay: £[NOTICE_PAY]]

Final payment total: £[FINAL_TOTAL]
sections.compliance_notes: Must pay all accrued entitlements including holiday pay

sections.text:
Benefits:

Your benefits will cease on [TERMINATION_DATE]. Please note:

- Pension contributions will cease on your last day
- [BENEFIT_1 - e.g., Company car] must be returned by [RETURN_DATE]
- [BENEFIT_2 - e.g., Health insurance] will terminate on [TERMINATION_DATE]
- [BENEFIT_3 - e.g., Life assurance] will terminate on [TERMINATION_DATE]

Time Off for Job Search:

You are entitled to reasonable paid time off during your notice period to look for alternative employment or arrange training, in accordance with ERA 1996 s52.

[OPTIONAL: We will also provide outplacement support through [PROVIDER] to assist with your job search.]
sections.compliance_notes: Statutory right to reasonable paid time off for job hunting (employees with 2+ years' service being made redundant)

sections.text:
Return of Company Property:

Please return the following items by [RETURN_DATE]:

- [PROPERTY_1]
- [PROPERTY_2]
- [PROPERTY_3]
- All documents, data, and materials (in any format)
- Company credit cards and access passes

Please also delete all Company data from personal devices and confirm compliance in writing.

Reference:

We will provide a fair and accurate reference upon request from prospective employers.
sections.compliance_notes: No legal obligation to provide reference, but if provided must be fair and accurate

sections.text:
Right of Appeal:

If you wish to appeal against the decision to make you redundant or the selection process, you must submit your appeal in writing to [APPEAL_CONTACT] within [APPEAL_DAYS] working days of receiving this letter, stating your grounds for appeal.

Your appeal will be heard by [APPEAL_PERSON/PANEL] who was/were not involved in the original decision.
sections.compliance_notes: Appeal process required for fair redundancy procedure; tribunal may increase award by 25% for ACAS Code breach

sections.text:
I recognise this is difficult news. If you have any questions or wish to discuss this further, please contact [CONTACT_PERSON] on [CONTACT_DETAILS].

Yours sincerely,


[SIGNATORY_NAME]
[SIGNATORY_TITLE]

compliance_checklist: Full consultation process completed before notice issued
Genuine redundancy situation under ERA 1996 s139
Fair and objective selection criteria applied
Alternative employment considered and offered if available
Statutory redundancy pay calculated correctly (2+ years service)
Weekly pay cap applied (£700 from April 2025)
All accrued entitlements paid (holiday, bonus, etc)
Collective consultation if 20+ redundancies (45+ days for 100+)
HR1 notification to DECC if 20+ redundancies
